text:
e="preserve">Bette Joan Henritze (May 23, 1924 – February 22, 2018) was an American actress. She was born in Betsy Layne, Kentucky. She played supporting roles in movies like "The World According to Garp", "The Hospital", "Far From Heaven", and "Judy Berlin". She was most known for her work in Off-Broadway theatre. In 1967 she received the Obie Award.
Henritze died in Lynbrook, New York on February 22, 2018 at the age of 93.
